conclusion: Initial analysis of how shadows change with light source movement
The light source is initially positioned to the left of the objects, casting shadows to the right
The light source moves to the right and directly above the objects
Shadows will shift to be directly beneath the objects when the light source is directly above
Shadows tend to be smaller when the light source is directly overhead
Shadow A (ball) moves directly under the ball and becomes smaller
Shadow B (blue object) moves directly under the blue object and becomes smaller
Shadow C (crack) shadow effect would minimize
Shadow D (blue object extension) moves directly under the extension of the blue object and becomes smaller
Final answer: Shadows A, B, C, and D will shift to be directly beneath their respective objects and will become smaller
